column1: 47	There is no provision in either document you cite which states that keeping all the fruits of our earnings is a fundamental part of freedom.  Our founding fathers were involved in colony governments before they were involved in the revolution. In Virginia
column2: our House of Burgesses provided money every year to every widow and orphan
column3: and we also used our tax money to construct projects for the common good. We also had courts to help protect our rights. When we had our revolution
column4: we were opposed to taxation without representation
column5: but we were not opposed to taxation. We have never been.

column1: You seem to have a narrow and limited view of humanity and our responsibility to create a just society
column2: which is based on parts of our founding documents that do not exist.

column1: 48	Ethically
column2: it's not okay for anyone to invade the privacy of an innocent person.  It's stupid and potentially dangerous to stalk celebrities
column3: and many suits have been brought against various photographers and publications.  However
column4: we have the right to know what the government is doing-- because it's with our money.  Governments steal from us
column5: then use the fruits of their theft against us.  This is why the 4th Amendment is necessary-- it protects our privacy from overreaching and potentially abusive government intrusion.  Any attempts to nullify the 4th Amendment would be a grave mistake
column6: as it is a crucial check on government power.

column1: 49	It has been established in the minds of many people
column2: but there are some who remain difficult to convince
column3: due to their faith in the government and a lack of belief that it could carry out such heinous acts. These individuals will eventually come around when the country is placed under Martial law
column4: complete with curfews and citizens reduced to prisoners in their own homes.  Fortunate ones will be incarcerated in the 600+ concentration camps that have already been constructed around the country. The less fortunate will suffer similar fates.
